meanings.definition: Move hurriedly with short, quick steps.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit was scuttering across the field to escape the fox.
meanings.sent2: I saw a squirrel scuttering up the tree trunk in the park.
meanings.sent3: The children were scuttering around the playground, full of energy.
meanings.sent4: The leaves scuttered along the ground in the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The mouse scuttered into its hole as soon as it heard a noise.

meanings.definition: The sound of something moving quickly and noisily.
meanings.sent1: The scuttering of the squirrel's claws on the tree bark echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the scuttering of tiny feet in the attic.
meanings.sent3: The scuttering of the rain on the roof made it hard to fall asleep.
meanings.sent4: The scuttering of the skateboard wheels on the pavement filled the air.
meanings.sent5: The scuttering of the ants marching in a line was fascinating to watch.

meanings.sent1: The wind scuttered the fallen leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent2: She scuttered the papers on her desk in a rush to find the important document.
meanings.sent3: The kids scuttered the toys all over the living room during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The birds scuttered in all directions when the cat approached.
meanings.sent5: The sand scuttered away from the shovel as he dug in the beach.
